name: Research and Records
section_name: Learn about Kansas research and records.

choices.name: Get started with research for your Kansas ancestors.

hidden.summary:
• Learn successful research strategies for Kansas ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Kansas research.

text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Kansas research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Kansas Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Kansas ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Kansas Research, 1880-Present

  3. Watch this video for ideas on Kansas research.

    ☆ FS—United States Research: Great Plains Region - Kansas—2:48

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Kansas research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Kansas Resources
    ☆ AC—Kansas State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Kansas Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Kansas Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Kansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Kansas

    2. Learn more about African American records in this article.

      ☆ AG—Kansas African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Kansas.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Kansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Kansas
Additional Records

1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

name: Archives and Libraries
section_name: Learn about Kansas archives and libraries.

choices.name: Learn about Kansas archives and libraries.

hidden.summary:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Kansas archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Kansas Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Kansas State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research
  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Kansas.
  3. Explore the Kansas State Archives genealogy collection.
  4. Explore the Kansas Memory Project.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Kansas genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Kansas research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.summary:
• Explore city and county directories to find Kansas ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

hidden.exercises:
• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

text:
1. Learn about Kansas city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Kansas Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Kansas city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Kansas city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Kansas ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Kansas city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    7. Exercises
    • * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
    • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

name: Maps and Gazetteers

  • Learn more about how to use Kansas periodical and manuscripts.

• Find research clues in the Library of Congress historical newspaper collection.
  • Search Kansas online newspaper sites.

  2. Find links to Kansas newspapers on the Wikipedia site.
  3. Search the Kansas Online Historical Newspapers site.

choices.name: There are a number of websites with valuable resources for Kansas research.

text:
1. Explore links in ☆Cyndi's List.
  2. Explore links in ☆Linkpendium.
  3. Explore links in ☆Genealogylinks.net.
  4. Explore links in ☆LDSGenealogy.com.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Kansas County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Kansas.

text: Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Kansas Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

name: Get Help
section_name: Get help with your Kansas research.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

text:
1. Visit the Kansas Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Kansas Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Kansas Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Midwest Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Kansas.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Kansas research.
  2. Explore the Kansas research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Kansas research.

hidden.exercises: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Kansas in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Kansas Societies

  2. Explore the Kansas State Historical Society site.
  3. Explore the Midwest Historical and Genealogical Society site.
  4. Explore Kansas genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  5. Get help at a family history center in Kansas.
